messages.subject: Minnesota Unschoolers?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi everyone, I am pretty new to this list, but I have a few questions maybe someone out there can help me with. My name is Sandi.  I currently live in St
messages.messageBody:
Hi everyone,

I am pretty new to this list, but I have a few questions maybe someone out
there can help me with.

My name is Sandi. I currently live in St Louis, Missouri, where we
unschool our two children ages 8 and 5. We are considering a move to
Minnesota, but I am a bit put off by their homeschooling laws.

I was just wondering if there are any unschoolers from Minnesota out
there. I know they exist, but I would like to hear from them how they deal
with the regulations and testing. One of the reasons we took the kids out
of school in the first place was all the silly testing, and though I would
love to move to MN, if it means giving up my right to unschool my kids, I
am not sure we will do it.

Thanks in advance for any insight into this.

Sandi in St Louis
--------------------------------------------------------------
"What we want to see is the child in pursuit of knowledge, not knowledge in
pursuit of the child."
-- George Bernard Shaw

Piston Ported Vespas:
http://members.nbci.com/piston_ported/index.html
words
http://www.geocities.com/vespass/words.html
ST Louis Secular Homeschooler's Co-Op
http://www.stlsecularhomeschool.org

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] naturalchild
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/16/01 8:12:54 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... It is www.naturalchild.com A wonderful resource for AP and deschooling. cath
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/16/01 8:12:54 PM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:


You know, I wish I could remember the web address for the Natural Child
Project. It has tons of essays(many written by psychiatrists!) about the
benefits of co-sleeping, late breast feeding, and topics of the like

It is www.naturalchild.com

A wonderful resource for AP and deschooling.

cath
